home.title: The magic tome that helps masters keeping up with their lore
home.whatIsThisText: This is a tool that helps you keep up with your lore. You can ask questions about your campaign and the lore keeper will try to answer them as best as possible. If the information you ask is not in the lore keeper's database, it will tell you clearly so. This way you can improve your lore, or just answer "quickly" to your players.
home.howDoesItWorkText:
The Lore Keeper is a tool that uses a machine learning model to answer questions about your lore. But how can you teach him your lore?
You can load PDFs files in the "Load Docs" section, and the Lore Keeper will split them, read them and learn from them by summarizing the documents, extracting keywords and storing the information in an internal memory.
home.temporaryLimitsText: Yep unfortunately the Lore Keeper has some limits that I plan to address  in the future :

temporaryLimitsList.pdf: The Lore Keeper can only read PDF files
temporaryLimitsList.uploading: Uploading the documents is a computationally expensive operation: the smaller the documents the quicker it will be to upload them!
temporaryLimitsList.oneDoc: As for now it can only load one document a time
temporaryLimitsList.timeForResponse: When you ask questions, the lore keeper will search among the saved documents, please expect some loading times and some freezing (you are running an AI model on your browser)
temporaryLimitsList.gpuNeeded: A GPU is needed to run the model

home.worksOfflineText: The Lore Keeper works without any connection, so even in the deepest of the dungeons you can find answers to your questions. You will have to be online only the first time you load the page, to download the model.

documentLoader.uploadDocuments: Upload new documents to expand the lore of your world, each document will  be used for future searches. Through AI it will we possible to create  small summaries of your documents that will be used to index the articles  and to know what document to search when you ask a question (at least  that's the idea).
documentLoader.uploadDocuments2: Each document will have an original title and a title, the original title  is the name of the document as it was uploaded, the title is the name that  the AI think it suits the document.
documentLoader.uploadDocuments3: Please expect some time for the documents to be processed, the more  documents you upload the more time it will take (it also depends on your  pc specs).
documentLoader.stopExplain: This will interrupt the process and reload the app, but the saveddocuments will be safe in the Lore Keeper's memory

askQuestions.chatWithTheLoreKeeperText:
Here you can ask questions about the lore of your campaign. The lore keeper will try to answer your questions as best as possible.
If the information you ask is not in the lore keeper's database, it will tell you clearly so. This way you can improve your lore.
askQuestions.loreKeeperWelcome:
Greetings, Esteemed Master of Adventures.
                         I am the Lore Keeper, your faithful guide through the vast tapestry of your imagination.
                         In this sacred space, I stand ready to assist you in unearthing the secrets woven
                          into the very fabric of your lore. Should you seek knowledge of illustrious heroes,
                           ancient realms, or fateful events, do not hesitate to summon my wisdom.

aiAssistant.instruction: You are a helpful AI assistant that organizes and summarizes documents with a minimum of 400 characters
aiAssistant.originalTitle: this is the original title of the document: {{originalDocumentTitle}}

splitDocument.part: This is part {{index}} of a split document of {{totalParts}}

title.normalInstruction: The title should recall the original document name if it is significant otherwise you can use a generic title based on the content

jsonFormat.summary: string //the summary of the content MUST BE MINIMUM 400 characters NO LESS
jsonFormat.keywords: string[] //the keywords of the content, all important concepts should be here, for example Names of people, places, etc.

aiAssistant.finalInstruction: Your answer should ONLY contain the JSON, nothing else.
